intro: Ditassa emmerichiae, commonly known as the Emmerich's ditassa, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
